titles.title: A bill to require congressional approval of loans made by the Secretary of Transportation in excess of $1,000,000,000.
A bill to require congressional approval of loans made by the Secretary of Transportation in excess of $1,000,000,000.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: Prohibits the Secretary from making a loan or loans to any entity in excess of $1 billion in the aggregate over a five-year period unless the loan exceeding the limit is approved by joint resolution no later than six months after notice is provided to Congress.
